results.description:
JOB TITLE:¬†Operations Manager

DIVISION:¬†Nuclear

LOCATION OF WORK:¬†

Remote ‚Äì based in one of the following states:

  • Colorado
  • Florida
  • Idaho
  • Minnesota
  • New Jersey
  • New Mexico
  • North Carolina
  • Ohio
  • Oregon
  • Tennessee
  • Utah
  • Virginia
  • Washington D.C.
  • Washington

TRAVEL EXPECTATIONS:¬†Must be willing to relocate to the to-be-determined U.S. MMR facility location.

DESCRIPTION:

The Operations Manager reports to the Manager, Reactor Manufacturing. The Operations Manager responsibilities include:

  • Develop Manufacturing Management Frameworks & Systems for Manufacturing Team; MRP, Maintenance, Lean, CI, HPI,DFA, DFM, Change Control, etc.
  • MRP System Implementation, Financial Planning (CAPEX, OPEX), production scheduling, work cell planning, procurement, etc.
  • Workforce planning & development Skill Set Identification, training program development, integration with local educational institutions
  • Factory & Manufacturing Systems testing and acceptance programs
  • Prototype assembly processes and systems
  • Develop and implement Manufacturing assurance, oversight of manufacturing governance programs


MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES:

The main responsibilities and authorities for the Operations Manager are:

  • Manufacturing Integration: The Operations Manager is responsible for developing programs, processes and procedures for all aspects of MMR manufacturing including process design, quality assurance, facilities engineering, manufacturing engineering, tool and equipment design, information technology, safety, product development, Lean Six-Sigma, and machinery maintenance. They support Design Engineering in manufacturing process Research and Development, including prototype construction and testing.
  • Must have a broad understanding of all manufacturing processes, with the ability to choose optimized production methods.
  • Must be able to perform break even analyses based on cost, quantity, and other risk factors.
  • Extensive experience in the NQA-1 quality environment, including qualification and commercial grade dedication.
  • Work under both DOE and NRC regulatory oversite a plus.
  • Factory Readiness: As a key member of the Factory Readiness Team, the Operations Manager works closely with Core Division, Construction, Customers, Supply Chain and Logistics to develop and implement integrated corporate systems needed to manage, design, construct, develop the workforce, establish supply chains, commission, and operate the MMR manufacturing facility leveraging standardized and repeatable systems and processes. These systems will ensure that USNC can rapidly deploy manufacturing facilities, manufacture high-quality nuclear components, meet regulatory and quality requirements, meet production goals and do so in a safe, environmentally sound, and financially responsible manner.
  • 20 years o more supply chain management experience is required.
  • Framework Developer: Develops the supply chain structure at the highest levels, including make or buy, sourcing strategies, equipment purchases, and site interfaces and boundaries.
  • Extensive supplier development experience including supplier: identification, support, quality support, and scheduling.
  • Value Engineering: As part of the product and production development phase the manufacturing integration leader works closely with Design Engineering to develop parts, subassemblies and systems that not only meet performance requirements, but are repeatable, interchangeable, and economically producible.
  • Finance: As Manufacturing Integration leader, they work with Finance and the controller to develop and maintain both overhead and project budgets. They develop Basis of Estimates and assist in the proposal process. They are familiar with working in an earned value management system of budgeting and accounting. They implement labor optimization strategies.
  • Staffing: The manufacturing integration manager is also responsible for establishing and developing a management staff for the integration group to include managers of Industrial/Facilities Engineering, QA, Manufacturing Engineering, Information Engineering (IT), Lean Six-Sigma, site specific Integration Managers, Safety and Nuclear Safety.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Must possess a BS or BA minimum in Manufacturing Technology, Engineering, Business or a related field. An MBA is preferred.
  • Extensive experience developing and managing Manufacturing Engineering and design of nuclear manufacturing processes for nuclear-grade components and systems. Experience must include implementation of ERP/MRP systems.
  • Experience developing and converting to paperless manufacturing and supply chain processes.
  • Extensive experience managing nuclear facility business systems, manufacturing operations, and associated programs, processes, and procedures including corrective action and root cause analysis programs.
  • Minimum 20 years of Management or Leadership experience in a nuclear environment including experience with Nuclear Safety Culture, Safety Conscious Work Environment, Lean Enterprise Systems, DFA/DFMA, Integrated Safety Management Systems (ISMS), and Design for Six Sigma
  • Strong commitment to employee safety and well-being

PREFERRED SKILLS & EXPERIENCES:

  • Proven ability to implement Lean manufacturing methodology in new and existing production settings. The aptitude to develop Lean practices both at the cell level and factory wide, in both manufacturing and office process settings.
  • Extensive knowledge of Nuclear Safety Systems, Nuclear Change Evaluation, and working in NRC Nuclear licensed and regulated environments
  • Experience developing and implementing Assurance Programs; both NQA-1 and ISO 9001 quality programs and processes, Contractor Assurance, Conduct of Operations/Readiness, and the Software Management Programs.
  • Knowledge of EVMS (Earned Value Management Systems) including budget development and maintenance, (CAM) control account management, and proforma financial forecasting.
  • Understanding of records management and document control (RMDC) systems.
  • Candidate must be a Qualified Six-Sigma Black Belt
  • Must have working knowledge or be familiar with SharePoint, Microsoft Office Suite
  • Have effective communication skills and understanding of the corporate culture with an ability to influence key stakeholders and decision makers across USNC
  • Exceptional leadership, communication, problem solving, and conflict resolution skills
  • Proficient in computer skills and possess the ability to effectively use various analytical, design, project management, and presentation computer programs
  • Required: Data analysis and Statistical skills. Experience with Minitab or other statistical analysis tools.
  • Have excellent verbal, written communication, and time management skills
  • Advanced technical writing skills: develop policies, procedures, guides, and program description documents.
  • Have a strong orientation toward internal and external customers
  • Work with other departments to increase overall strength of the group and company
  • Must be an excellent negotiator and motivator.
  • Possess excellent verbal and writing skills to effectively communicate with others
  • Effectively manage, supervise, motivate, direct, coordinate and provide guidance to the staff of the departments
  • Must be able to not only manage but lead large cross-functional teams of personnel in disbursed locations, and multicultural environments.
  • Possess the ability to influence and motivate stakeholders who are not under your direct operational control.
  • Resolve project and operational issues
  • Analyze and solve problems daily
  • The ability to balance analysis and urgency when making decisions where all of the data may not be readily available.
  • Maintains collaborative, courteous, and respectful relationships
  • Ability to foster a collaborative team environment

TO APPLY:

Please include the following in your application in PDF format:

  • Cover Letter
  • Resume

EXPORT CONTROL REQUIREMENTS:

To confirm to U.S. Government space technology export regulations, including the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) you must be a U.S. citizen, lawful permanent resident of the U.S., or a protected individual as defined by 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3).

  • Are you legally authorized to work in the United States?
  • Will you now or in the future require sponsorship for an immigration-related employment benefit (e.g., H-1B, TN, green card, etc.)?

EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYMENT:

USNC embraces diversity and equal opportunity and is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are striving to build the diverse, equitable, and inclusive workforce that will make our technology a reality. USNC actively encourages applicants from historically underrepresented backgrounds to apply to this and other roles, acknowledging and committing to address the historical lack of diversity within the nuclear and aerospace industries.

USNC does not discriminate based on race, color, religion, gender, national origin/ethnicity, veteran status, disability status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, mental or physical disability, or any other legally protected status.

ABOUT ULTRA SAFE NUCLEAR:

Based in Seattle, Ultra Safe Nuclear Corporation (USNC) develops nuclear hardware and services for reliable, clean energy anywhere on Earth and in space. USNC offers full-stack capabilities including specialized reactor design services, advanced materials and fuel development, and reactor manufacturing and system deployment.

USNC has offices in USA, Canada, France, Korea, Poland, South Africa, the UK and more.

results.title: Squad Lead
results.description:
¬†

Sherpany is the Swiss market leader for meeting management software. Since its founding in 2011 it has pursued the goal of creating a world in which every meeting counts. Over 300 European companies and 12,000 decision-makers are already using Sherpany with the aim of making their business relevant meetings more productive and thereby increasing corporate success. According to a jury of international investors, Sherpany is one of the best scale-ups in Switzerland with the potential to become a unicorn. Sherpany employs over 150 people in six locations in Europe and remotely in 19 countries around the world.


The role:
You are part of our product department, consisting of 60 people and divided into different squads/sub-teams. In this role you partner with the product owner and coach the team with members from Engineering, UX, UI, QA and Data Analysis. You will guide them towards a sustainable continuous pace and support them in their development to maturity. You plan and orchestrate work execution and help our self-organized teams to achieve their goals. With your coaching they are led towards transparency, information exchange and collaboration and engage in continuous improvement efforts. It will also be your task to encourage cross-squad collaboration and communication, build sustainable working relationships with your colleagues and guide them in their personal development.

This job is for you if:¬†

  • You look forward to supporting our team with your broad know-how and practical experience as a Scrum Master/Squad Leader/Agile Coach or similar.
  • In your former jobs you have worked in software development environments.
  • You love mentoring a team towards its full potential, by using your empathy, interpersonal communication skills and trying out and coaching agile concepts.¬†
  • You are able to fluently converse and write in English when communicating with your team

  • In order to maintain your work-life balance we offer flexible working hours, home office and/or remote-working
  • Your personal and professional development is important to us which is why we offer financial support for further education, training, etc.
  • We work with modern Apple products; every employee receives a MacBook to work with
  • Last but not least: Our corporate culture means a lot to us, which is why we organize regular team events and cultivate a value-centric cooperation

results.title: Human Resources Business Partner Lead
results.description:
Company Description
Since we opened our doors in 2009, the world of commerce has evolved immensely, and so has Square. After enabling anyone to take payments and never miss a sale, we saw sellers stymied by disparate, outmoded products and tools that wouldn‚Äôt work together.

To solve this problem, we expanded into software and built integrated solutions to help sellers sell online, manage inventory, book appointments, engage loyal buyers, and hire and pay staff. Across it all, we‚Äôve embedded financial services tools at the point of sale, so merchants can access a business loan and manage their cash flow in one place. Afterpay furthers our goal to provide omnichannel tools that unlock meaningful value and growth, enabling sellers to capture the next generation shopper, increase order sizes, and compete at a larger scale.

Today, we are a partner to sellers of all sizes ‚Äì large, enterprise-scale businesses with complex operations, sellers just starting, as well as merchants who began selling with Square and have grown larger over time. As our sellers grow, so do our solutions. There is a massive opportunity in front of us. We‚Äôre building a significant, meaningful, and lasting business, and we are helping sellers worldwide do the same.

Job Description

Our HR Business Partners (HRBP) support specific teams, working closely with management and employees on people-related issues: talent management, employee relations, coaching/development, compensation, conflict and performance management, organizational development and more. HRBPs are instrumental in initiating and driving HR programs and initiatives within specific functions.

We‚Äôre looking for a HRBP Lead to drive people and business initiatives across Square. You are someone who is interested in making a significant impact in our Customer Success organization and excels in a fast-paced, high engagement environment with extraordinary desire to innovate. You will work closely with business leaders to provide hands-on and strategic input, insight, and advice with respect to employee relations, performance management, coaching, compensation, conflict management, organizational development, training and more. You‚Äôre comfortable speaking up and driving initiatives forward despite any unexpected roadblocks. You will report to Square's HR Lead.¬†¬†

You will:

  • Partner with mid-level management and senior executives to develop and implement effective HR policies and practices to support the strategic growth of the business
  • Provide HR expertise in the areas of compensation, feedback, performance management, employee relations, development and coaching, and organizational development
  • Offer thought leadership regarding organizational and people-related strategy and execution
  • Collaborate with the People team to champion and accelerate a culture of excellence in which people feel engaged and inspired to deliver top business results
  • Develop multi-year people strategies and design approaches for diagnosing and enhancing organizational effectiveness and employee satisfaction
  • Lead core HR processes such as performance calibration, compensation cycle, promotions
  • Analyze and interpret various types of employee reports (eg, compensation, job levels, and attrition) to guide decision-making and provide proactive solutions to client groups
  • Partner with HRBP and Learning & Programs colleagues to work on value-added programs in areas of training, development, career mobility and job performance


Qualifications

You have:¬†

  • Minimum 8 years experience in HR and prior experience leading teams
  • Relevant experience building and improving company culture and increasing employee engagement, and expertise in performance management
  • Superb communication skills, including effective facilitation, listening and writing
  • Demonstrated analytical thinking, problem solving and decision making skills
  • Effective coaching and facilitation skills and ability to influence colleagues at all levels of the organization
  • Knowledge of HR programs and practices, including applicable state and federal employment laws and regulations
  • Track record of strategic partnering with Customer Success¬†and/or Go-to-market¬†business leaders on multi-year company or org-wide people initiatives


Additional Information

Block takes a market-based approach to pay, and pay may vary depending on your location. U.S. locations are categorized into one of four zones based on a cost of labor index for that geographic area. The successful candidate‚Äôs starting pay will be determined based on job-related skills, experience, qualifications, work location, and market conditions. These ranges may be modified in the future.

Zone B: USD $171,200 - USD $209,200

Zone D: USD $152,700 - USD $186,700

To find a location‚Äôs zone designation, please refer to this resource. If a location of interest is not listed, please speak with a recruiter for additional information.¬†

Benefits include the following:

  • Healthcare coverage
  • Retirement Plans including company match¬†
  • Employee Stock Purchase Program
  • Wellness programs, including access to mental health, 1:1 financial planners, and a monthly wellness allowance¬†
  • Paid parental and caregiving leave
  • Paid time off
  • Learning and Development resources
  • Paid Life insurance, AD&D. and disability benefits¬†
  • Perks such as WFH reimbursements and free access to caregiving, legal, and discounted resources¬†

This role is also eligible to participate in Block's equity plan subject to the terms of the applicable plans and policies, and may be eligible for a sign-on bonus. Sales roles may be eligible to participate in a commission plan subject to the terms of the applicable plans and policies. Pay and benefits are subject to change at any time, consistent with the terms of any applicable compensation or benefit plans.

We‚Äôre working to build a more inclusive economy where our customers have equal access to opportunity, and we strive to live by these same values in building our workplace. Block is a proud equal opportunity employer. We work hard to evaluate all employees and job applicants consistently, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, pregnancy, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, citizenship, or any other legally protected class.¬†

We believe in being fair, and are committed to an inclusive interview experience, including providing reasonable accommodations to disabled applicants throughout the recruitment process. We encourage applicants to share any needed accommodations with their recruiter, who will treat these requests as confidentially as possible.¬†Want to learn more about what we‚Äôre doing to build a workplace that is fair and square? Check out our I+D page.¬†

Additionally, we consider qualified applicants with criminal histories for employment on our team, and always assess candidates on an individualized basis.

Block, Inc. (NYSE: SQ) is a global technology company with a focus on financial services. Made up of Square, Cash App, Spiral, TIDAL, and TBD, we build tools to help more people access the economy. Square helps sellers run and grow their businesses with its integrated ecosystem of commerce solutions, business software, and banking services. With Cash App, anyone can easily send, spend, or invest their money in stocks or Bitcoin. Spiral (formerly Square Crypto) builds and funds free, open-source Bitcoin projects. results.description:
Potential to earn $40,000-$120,000 in your first year with average recruiters making $120,000-$200,000 in the second year ($19.23/hour + Commission)!

As part of the Host Healthcare Recruitment team, the Senior Recruiter drives successful placements of clinicians on assignment across multiple healthcare specialties and clients. Senior Recruiters develop strong relationships with clinicians nationwide through proactive outreach efforts to recruit and place them in open temporary job opportunities aligned with their clinical and specialty experience across health systems, acute care hospitals, outpatient clinics, home health organizations and more.

The successful Senior Recruiter is self-motivated, with a strong desire to meet or exceed placement goals and passion for helping clinicians to thrive in their careers. The recruiter is a creative, energetic individual with excellent interpersonal communication skills and professional demeanor and maturity. The Senior Recruiter maintains a positive outlook and serves as a positive influence within the team. He or she is also well-organized, comfortable working in a fast-paced environment, and exhibits Host‚Äôs core values of Team Strength, Personal Accountability, Leading with Integrity, Driven by Excellence, Embracing Positivity and Mastering Our Craft.


Essential Duties & Responsibilities:

Qualifications:

‚Ä¢ High school diploma required. Bachelor‚Äôs degree preferred.

‚Ä¢ Previous sales experience and/or healthcare knowledge preferred.

‚Ä¢ Excellent verbal and written communications. Able to negotiate and problem-solve collaboratively with candidates and internal team members.

‚Ä¢ Excellent time management and prioritization skills. Able to maintain an organized, well-run sales desk and meet required turnaround times. Comfortable within in a fast-paced work environment.

‚Ä¢ High comfort level operating within technology platforms (e.g., Target Recruit)

results.title: Site Reliability Engineer
results.description:
Zipdev is looking to add a remote Site Reliability Engineer to its team of LatAm developers! As a Site Reliability Engineer, you will work as an integrated member of product teams to help build, deploy and reliably monitor cloud services. You will work on complex software development projects to keep important, revenue-critical services up. You will actively develop code and build frameworks to monitor the services deployed in production to drive reliability and performance across a massive scale.

We're looking for a talented Site Reliability Engineer who can work under minimal supervision, define test procedures, and collaborate closely with Developers, Designers, Customer Support, and Engineering Leadership.

What you will do:

  • Build systems and infrastructure to monitor complex, large-scale distributed systems
  • Identify stability/performance issues and collaborate with developers to triage critical issues in production systems.
  • Represent the SRE organization in design reviews and operational readiness exercises for new and existing services
  • Devise ways to actively monitor system throughput, capacity and reliability.
  • Ability to debug complex systems and evolve a running environment without downtime.
  • Engage in service capacity planning and demand forecasting, software performance analysis and system tuning
  • Drive standardization efforts across multiple disciplines and services in conjunction with embedded SREs throughout the organization

Requirements

  • Understanding of systems and application design, including the operational trade-offs of various designs.
  • Demonstrable knowledge of Unix, TCP/IP, HTTP, web application security, and experience supporting multi-tier web application architectures.
  • Experience in analyzing logs and troubleshooting large-scale distributed systems.
  • Excellent organization, time management, and communication skills
  • We‚Äôre looking for a person who has extensive Linux (Debian based) experience

  • A working understanding of IaC and configuration management tools such as Ansible, Saltstack, Terraform"
  • Experience with one or more general-purpose programming/scripting languages including but not limited to: Python, Bash, Perl or Go.
